an item that gives you damage reduction but only allows you to move in a direction perpendicular to the direction you're firing
a quick-charge item that teleports you to the opposite position in the room (i.e. if you're in the nw corner you move to the se corner, etc)
a powerful damage-up item that makes your tear hitboxes very small
an item that gives tears down and gives your tears miniature clones of your orbitals
a bomb item that causes your bombs to spawn 3-4 spiders when they blow up
a familiar that seeks out the closest nonboss enemy and "possesses" (charms) them
already exists, 2 for 1 though
a bomb upgrade that creates a brimstone/technology-style beam connecting it to isaac and causes your bombs to take twice as long to blow up
a shop item that increases the proc rate on all status effect tears/loki's horns/etc
an item that blindfolds isaac; all enemies in the room with isaac take chip damage over time based off of isaac's tear stats
an item that tanks your luck and boosts everything else

WRITING.TITLE: What are the current recommended quality of life mods for this game?
My gnomad monks are dying of thirst.
WRITING.TEXT: Two of them have keeled over. I have plenty of yak's milk, orange wine, and well water. What gives? Are they just training themselves to death?
Nah, they had access to all of the above.
i would like this, if only for the increased survivability of allies. why must you suicide unnecessarily, my monkey friends :(
today i learned that if you quaff-id levitation you better wait for it to wear off before quaffing the rest of your stuff if you're hoping to use water/mud nearby in case of accidental incineration

ran into a wraith at the start of depth 7, tried polymorphing it, which turned it into a dar blademaster, threw a potion of confusion at it, nearly got away before it slowed me and i was overtaken by the cloud, then a vampire bat got me i had not yet fully ided the spear of quietus, regardless of its enchantment it didn't save me

WRITING.TITLE: What's your general starting M.O.?
WRITING.TEXT: That is to say, how do you tend to play your first few levels? I generally hoard items until Depth 3, then ID all my potions in the hope of getting detect magic. From there, I try to guide my play based on what I've got for equipment, but I think I might be making that decision too early. I don't generally get very far in this game, that's for sure.
once had a gnome pick up another gnome's severed head and beat their murderer to death with it, it was metal as fuck

that i could take that screenshot speaks to issues here far more important than me getting kicked out. i don't care that much about getting kicked out, but this kind of shit is the kind of shit you really don't want to see in your only technically unofficial community for a game. it looks really bad. it is really bad in itself, and really bad for pr. in conclusion, eat my entire ass

it'd be like if i said "white nationalism" and somebody posted a picture of their totally ironic swastika armband in response. and it goes entirely without comment or rebuke. at a certain point you have to back up and ask yourself how you got from point a to such a horrid point b. is this when that happens? or will it keep festering?
the lesson to be learned here is level 12 dudes at the very least at all times
